post: Across the African continent, around 125 million tonnes of Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) was produced in 2012 with that number expectd to double by 2025! Learn how to play your part in waste recycling and earn a fee at #GreenifyAfrica

While Africa produces 125 million tonnes of Municipal Solid Waste (MSW) of which between 70-80% is recyclable, only 4% of that total is being recycled. You can increase that percentage by actively recycling AND getting paid at #GreenifyAfrica

Waste disposal across the continent is largely uncontrolled with over 90% of waste being disposed at uncontrolled landfills and dumpsites with associated burning. Join us and stop today at  #GreenifyAfrica

Waste collection is done often by informal actors who do so at little to no cost to the companies and little value to the actors themselves. Help us change this and increase the waste collected on our wonderful planet at #GreenifyAfrica

Egypt (~0.97 tonnes), Nigeria (~0.85 tonnes) and South Africa (~0.63 tonnes) are the biggest polluters across the African contineny with all three countries ranking 7th, 9th and 11th on the 20 major polluters in the world. Do your part today and reduce are waste footprint at #GreenifyAfrica
